item.fullName: Del. Radewagen, Aumua Amata Coleman [R-AS-At Large]
Del. Sablan, Gregorio Kilili Camacho [D-MP-At Large]

item.title: H.R. 4300, Admiral Lloyd R. “Joe” Vasey Pacific War Commemorative Display Establishment Act
H.R. 4300, Admiral Lloyd R. ‘Joe’ Vasey Pacific War Commemorative Display Establishment Act

item.text:
Admiral Lloyd R. "Joe" Vasey Pacific War Commemorative Display Establishment Act

This bill authorizes the Pacific Historic Parks to establish and maintain a commemorative display to honor the members of the U.S. Armed Forces and Allies who served in the Pacific Theater during World War II.

Federal funds may not be used to design, procure, prepare, install, or maintain the commemorative display, but the National Park Service may accept and expend contributions of nonfederal funds and resources for such purposes.
item.name: Introduced in House

item.text:
Admiral Lloyd R. "Joe" Vasey Pacific War Commemorative Display Establishment Act

(Sec. 4) This bill authorizes the Pacific Historic Parks to establish and maintain a commemorative display to honor the members of the U.S. Armed Forces and Allies who served in the Pacific Theater during World War II.

Federal funds may not be used to design, procure, prepare, install, or maintain the commemorative display, but the National Park Service may accept and expend contributions of nonfederal funds and resources for such purposes.
item.name: Reported to House without amendment

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
